Literature.Title: Design of potent 9-mer antimicrobial peptide analogs of protaetiamycine and investigation of mechanism of antimicrobial action.
Literature.Author: Shin S, Kim JK, Lee JY, Jung KW, Hwang JS, Lee J, Lee DG, Kim I, Shin SY, Kim Y

Literature.Title: Enantiomeric 9-mer Peptide Analogs of Protaetiamycine With Bacterial Cell Selectivities and Anti-Inflammatory Activities
Literature.Author: Lee E, Kim JK, Shin S, Jeong KW, Lee J, Lee DG, Hwang JS, Kim Y

Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: Horse erythrocytes:100% Hemolysis=25 µM,Human erythrocytes:10% Hemolysis=50 µM,Human erythrocytes:30% Hemolysis=100 µM
Sequence Information.Target Organism: Escherichia coli KCTC 1682(MIC=2µM),Pseudomonas aeruginosa KCTC 1637(MIC=8-16µM),Salmonella typhimurium KCTC 1926(MIC=8µM),Bacillus subtilis KCTC 3068(MIC=2µM),Staphylococcus epidermidis KCTC 1917(MIC=1µM),Staphylococcus aureus KCTC 1621(MIC=2µM),Staphylococcus aureus CCARM 3089(MIC=2µM),Staphylococcus aureus CCARM 3114(MIC=4µM),Salmonella typhimurium CCARM 8003(MIC=16µM),Salmonella typhimurium CCARM 8009(MIC=8µM),Escherichia coli CCARM 1229(MIC=8µM),Escherichia coli CCARM 1238(MIC=4µM),Murine macrophage cells RAW 264.7(50% Cell death=25µM)
